cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CG, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the Closest Vector Problem (CVP) on lattices, which is a fundamental problem in computer science and mathematics. The paper proposes a new approach to solving CVP by defining a lattice basis to be "c-compact" and proving the existence of such bases for certain lattices. This approach involves concepts from computational geometry, information theory, and graph theory, which are all relevant to the sub-categories listed. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.CG (Computational Geometry), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), and cs.LG (Machine Learning).
